projectDesc.p: The project DHARMA has received funding from the European Research Council (ERC) under the European Union's Horizon 2020 research and innovation programme (grant agreement no 809994).

prefixDef.p: Public URIs with the prefix bib to point to a Zotero Group Library named ERC-DHARMA whose data are open to the public.
Internal URIs using the part prefix to point to person elements in the DHARMA_idListMembers_v01.xml file.

div.p:
Front
//Oṃ Avighnam astu// svasti śakavarṣātīta 851 bhadravāda-māsa, tithi dvādaśi kr̥ṣṇa-pakṣa
pa, pa, vr̥, vāra, māgha-nakṣatra, pitara-devatā, parigha-yoga, Irikā divaśani Ājña śrī ma
hārāja rake hino pu[1] siṇḍok· śrī Īśānavikrama dharmmotuṅgadeva, Umiṁsor· I samgat· mo
maḥh-umaḥ kāliḥ maḍaṇḍər· pu padma, Aṅgəhān· pu kuṇḍala, kumonakan· Ikaṁ vanuA I liṅgasuntan·, va
tak· hujuṁ gavay·[2] mā 2 kaṭik· 2 paṅguhan[3] tapak· mas· su 3[4] Iṁ satahun·-satahun· sīmān· susukan· Arpanākna Arpaṇākna I
bhaṭara I valaṇḍit· paknānya sīma punpunana bhaṭāra Umyāpāra[6] Asiṁ samananā[7] I saṁ hyaṁ dharmma[8] muAṁ paṅimbuha ri kapūjān· bha
ṭāra Aṅkan· prativarṣa, maṅkana Iṣṭaprayojana śrī mahārāja Irikaṁ vanuA I liṅgasuntan· Inārpanākan· I bhaṭāra I
valaṇḍit·[9] māri vatak· hujuṁ, parṇnahanya svatantrā tan· katamāna deniṁ patiḥ vahuta muAṁ saprakāraniṁ maṅilala drabya ha-
ji riṁ daṅū miśra parāmiśra vulu-vulu prakāra paṅuraṁ, kriṁ, paḍam manimpiki, paranakan·, limus galuḥ paṅaruhan·, tiṅkəs, viji kavaḥ,
taji, vatu tajam·,[10] sukun·, halu varak·, rakadut·, pinilay·, kataṅgaran·, tapa haji, Air haji, malandaṁ lva, L̥b·blab·,[11] kalaṁ
kaṁ,[12] kutak·, taṁkil·,[13] tr̥pan·, salvit·,[14] vatu valaṁ, pamaṇikan·, maṇiga, sikpan·, rumbān·, vilaṁ vanuA, tuhān dagaṁ, juru gusali, maṁrumbai,[15]
maṁguñjai,[16] tuhān· nambi, tuhān huñjamman·, tuhān· juḍi, juru jalir, puluṁ paḍi, miśra hino, vli hapu, vli vaduṁ, vli tambaṁ, vli ha
R̥ṁ, vli pañjut·, palamak·, pakaluṁkuṁ, Urutan·, dampulan·, tpuṁ kavuṁ, suṁsuṁ paṅuraṁ, pasuk alas·, mapayuṅan·, sipat vilut·, pā-
ṅin-aṅin·, pamāvaśya, toḥ[17] karuṁ, hopan·, skar tahun·, panrāṅan·, panusuḥ, kḍi, valyan·, mahaliman·, vidu, sambal·, sumbul·,
haji, pamr̥ṣi vatak· I jro, Ityaivamādi, tan tamā[18] Irikaṁ vanuA sīma I liṅgasuntan·, kevalā[19] bhaṭāra I valaṇḍit·,[20] Ataḥ pramānā
ri sadrabya-hajinya kabaiḥ samaṅkana Ikaṁ sukhaduḥkha kady aṅgāniṁ mayaṁ tan· pavvaḥ valu rumambat· riṁ natar· vipati vaṅkai[21] kābunan· rāḥ kasa
vur vākcapalā duhilatan·[22] hidu kasirat· hastacapala pādacapala mamijilakan turaḥniṁ kikir·[23] mamuk· mamuṁpaṁ ludan· tutan· ḍaṇḍa kuḍa
ṇḍa bhaṇḍihalādi, bhaṭāra I valaṇḍit·[24] Ataḥ parānani[25] drabya-hajinya, kunaṁ Ikaṁ miśra mañambul· mañavriṁ maṁlākha[26] maṅapus· mapahaṅa
n·[27] maṅubar· matarub·[28] maṁgula maṁdyun· maṁhapu manula maruṁki[29] mapayuṁ vlu mopiḥ makajaṁ makisi mamubut· maṅanamm-anam· ma
navaṁ manahab· mamisaṇḍuṁ makala-kalā kāpva ya tribhāgān· drabya-hajinya sadūmān· marā I bhaṭāra sadūmān marā I saṁ makmitan· sīma sa
dūmān· mara I saṁ maṅilala drabya haji, kapva Ikaṁ masambyavahāra hana Iṁ sīma hinīṅan· kvehanya Anuṁ tan· knāna drabya haji tluṁ tuhā
n· I masambyavahāra[30] yan paṅulaṁ kbo 30 sapi 40 vḍus· 80 Aṇḍaḥ savantayan· maguluṅan· tluṁ pasaṁ, maṅaraḥ,[31] tluṁ lumpaṁ Atitiḥ saku
lit·, paṇḍai tluṁ Ububan·, Uṇḍahagi satuhān·, paḍahi[32] tluṁ taṅkilan·, macadar pataṁ pacadaran· parahu 1, masuṁhara[33] 3[34] ta
n patuṇḍāna yāpvan pinikul· dagaṅanya kady aṅgāniṁ mabasana masayaṁ, makacapuri maṅuñjal· makapas· vuṅkuḍu[35] vsi,[36]
tambaga gaṅsa timaḥ vuyaḥ paḍat· lṅa bras gula pamaja bsar·[37] kasumba saprakāraniṁ dval pinikul· kalima bantal· Iṁ satu
hāpn·[38] Ataḥ pikul-pikullananya[39] Iṁ sasīma, Ikanaṁ samaṁkana tan· knāna de saṁ maṅilala drabya haji saparānanya sadeśanya[40]
yāpvan· lviḥ saṁkerikanaṁ[41] knāna sakalviḥnya[42] sodhăra haji tan· Adhikāna[43] Irikaṁ kāla maṅasəAkan· Ikaṁ rāma[44] I liṅga
suntan· pasak-pasak· I śrī ma[hā]rāja mas· su 5,[45] vḍihan tapis·[46] yu 1,[47] rakai sirikan· pu Amarendra, rakai vka pu balyaṁ, sa
mgat· momah-umaḥ kāliḥ maḍaṇḍər· Aṅgəhan·[48] tiruAn· ḍapunta taritip· vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mas· su 1 mā 4 [49]
vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, Amrāti havaṁ vicakṣaṇa maṁhūri pu paṇḍamuAn· tilimpik pu dhanuka vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mas·
10 vḍihan· cadar· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, vadihati saṁ dinakara makudur· pu balavān· vinaiḥ pasak-pasak·
vḍihan· cadar· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, hujuṁ[50] Irikaṁ kāla pu madhura vinaiḥ pasak-pasak·[51] vḍihan· cadar· tu
hān· I hujuṁ vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mas· su 1 mā 4 kinabaihanira, tuhān i vadihati mira-miraḥ saṁ halaṁ pahu[ṁ halaran· saṁ lbur·]
poḥ[52] tuhān i makudur· vatu valaiṁ saṁ variṅin·, vatu kiluṁ saṁ tpusan· vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 10 vḍihan· cadar· hlai
sovaṁ-sovaṁ, paṅuraṁ I vadihati saṁ ra vuṅū,[53] Anuṅgū saṁ hovaṁka,[54] paṅuraṁ I makudur· saṁ ra kbəl·, Anuṅgū saṁ kulumpaṁ vinaiḥ
pasak· mā 5[55] vḍihan, cadar· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, tuhān iṁ pakaraṇān, juru kanayakān· I hino samgat· gunuṅa
n·, juru vadvā rarai saṁ ra guyu,[56] juru kalula pu bali,[57] kaṇḍamuhi saṁ geṣṭa,[58] parujar· Iṁ sirikan hujuṁ galuḥ I vka viri
diḥ I kanuruhan· saṁ rokat·, I sbaṁ saṁ bimala,[59] I bavaṁ saṁ satyaka,[60] I maḍaṇḍar saṁ cakra, Iy aṅgə
han· saṁ kuruhan·,[61] I tiruAn· saṁ sumuḍan· ḍapunta saṅgama, vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mas· su 1 mā 4[62] kinabaihanira,
saṁ citralekha I hino vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mas· su 1 mā 4 kinabaihanira, lumaku manusuk· I makudur, saṁ rā
ma,[63] lumaku manusuk· I vadihati saṁ Antagi[64] vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mas· su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· ragi[65] yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, pa
tiḥ juru kāliḥ vasaḥ saṁ kayu matəb·, kuci[66] saṁ campaluk· vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 4 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, parujarnya piṁsor hyaṁ pa
sovaṁ-sovaṁ,[67] patiḥ kahyūnan· ri hujuṁ rikaṁ kāla saṁ ḍampil· ramani karambət·[68] Back
saṁ bāṅi ramani bharana,[69] patiḥ maṁhāmbin· saṁ śaka, patiḥ pamgat· saṁ mambaṁ,[70] vinaiḥ pasa
k-pasak· mā 10 vḍihan· ragi yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, saṅ ambrivā[71] ramani marapi vinaiḥ
pasak· mas· su 1 mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 patiḥ lampuran· saṁ jarā, saṁ lagi,[72] saṁ juraṁbana,[73]
saṁ ḍaṅkal·, saṁ harivaṅśa, vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 4 vḍihan yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, parujar pa
tiḥ si pastika siy arik· vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 4 vḍihan· hlai 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, vahuta
kamasihan· ri hujuṁ rikaṁ kāla saṁ putra vinaiḥ pasak-pasak·, mas· su 1 mā 4 vḍihan·
yu 1,[74] vahuta paṅuñjaṅan· ri hujuṁ rikaṁ kāla saṁ valija bapani kḍu-kḍu[75] saṁ vidya vi
naiḥ pasak-pasak· mas· su 5, vḍihan· yu 5, kinabaihanira nayaka lampuran muAṁ[76] vahuta laguntan·[77]
patiḥ I kanuruhan· Umilu[78] pinakasākṣiniṁ manusuk ṣīma saṁ hiranya[79] vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 saṁ mā
dhava bapani damū vvaṁ ri tampuran· vinaiḥ pasak· mā 4 vḍihan·[80] yu 1 parujar· patiḥ I kanuruhan·, si Uṅgara[81] vinaiḥ pasak mā 1
vḍihan· hlai 1 patiḥ I tugaran· milu pinakasākṣiniṁ manusuk· saṁ cəṅgar·[82] vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1
vahuta I kanuruhan· paṅvahan·[83] saṁ vagai[84] vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 4 vḍi_han· hlai 1 tuhān iṁ kanayakān·[85] I siri
kan· saṁ dhara,[86] citralekha saṁ tulus·[87] vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 4 vḍihan· yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, rāma tpi si
riṁ milu pinakasākṣīniṁ manusuk· sīma, I sumari si pāda, I vurakutan· si baṇḍak·, I himad· si sambur·,[88]
I mliṁ-mliṁ,[89] si kuman·, I talijuṅan·[90] si lele, I paṅavān· I kanuruhan· si capa, I paṅavān· I hujuṁ si banava[91]
kapva vinaiḥ pasak-pasak· mā 1 ku 2 vḍihan· yu 1 sovaṁ-sovaṁ, saṁ ra guṇuṁ vinaiḥ pasak· mā 3[92] vḍihan· hlai 1 gu
ru hyaṁ lambuhuyu vinaiḥ mā 1, vḍihan· hlai 1 riṇḍi si diṅāda,[93] vinaiḥ pasak· mā 2 vḍihan· hlai 1 I tlasniṁ mavaiḥ
pasak-pasak· muAṁ vḍihan· I sira kabaiḥ pinarnaḥ Ikanaṁ saji I saṁ makudur· I sorniṁ vitāna maṅārgha saṁ pina
kaviku sumaṅaskāra Ikā saṁ hyaṁ susuk· muAṁ kulumpaṁ[94] maṁḍiri ta saṁ makudur· maṅañjali I saṁ hyaṁ təAs· maluṅguḥ I so
rniṁ vitāna man·dlān· pāḍa masiṁhəl· vḍihan· yu 1 humaR̥ppakan· saṁ hyaṁ təAs·, tumūt· ta saṁ vadihati, lumkas ta saṁ
makudur· maṅuyut· manətək· guluniṁ hayām· linaṇḍasakan· Iṁ kulumpaṁ, Amantiṅakan· han·tlū riṁ vatu sīma, mamaṁmaṁ ma
napathe saminaṁmaṁnira[95] daṅū I katguhakna saṁ hyaṁ sīma, Ikanaṁ līṁnira, Īndaḥ ta kita kamuṁ hyaṁ I śrī haricandāna Agasti mahā
R̥ṣi pūrbva[96] dakṣiṇa paścima Uttara māddhya Ūrdhamadhāḥ ravi śaśi kṣiti jala pavana hutāśana yajamānākāśa dharmma Ahorātra
sandhyā hr̥daya yakṣa rākṣasa pisāca, pretāsura garuḍa gandharvva[97] catvāri lokapāla yama buruṇa kuvera bāśava muAṁ putra
devatā pañcakusika nandīśvāra mahākāla ṣadvināyaka nāgarājā durggādevī caturāśra, Ananta surendra, Anaṅta[98] hyaṁ kā
lamr̥tyu gaṇa bhūta kita[99] prasiddha maṁrakṣaṁ kaḍatvan· śrī mahārāja I mḍaṁ Iṁ bhūmi matarām· kita Umilu[100]
masarīra Umasuk· riṁ sarbvasarīra[101] kita sakala bhūta sākṣī tumon madoḥ lāvan· mapaR̥[102] riṁ rahina riṁ vṅi
At R̥ṅə:Ākan· ta Ikiṁ samaya, sapatha sumpaḥ pamaṁmaṁ mami ri kita hiyaṁ kabaiḥ yāvat· Ikanaṁṅ uvaṁ[103] durācāra tan· mā
gam·[104] tan· makmit· Irikiṁ samaya sapatha sinrahakan· saṁ vahuta hyaṁ kudur· hadyan· hulun· matuha rarai laki-laki
vadvan· viku grahasta[105] patiḥ vahuta rāma Asiṁ Umulah-ulaḥ Ikiṁ vanuA sīma I liṅgasuntan· sinusuk· kan·[106]
śrī mahārāja rakai hino pu siṇḍok śrī Īśānavikrama dharmmotuṅgadeva I bhaṭāra[107] I valaṇḍit· I dlā
hanīṁ dlāha[108] An· babakan[109] ta ya ṅuniveḥ yan· davuta saṁ[110] hyaṁ vatu sīma tasmāt· kabvataknanya patyanantā ta ya ka
muṁ hyaṁ[111] deyantat patīya tat· tanoliha I vuntat· tat· tiṅhala I likuran· taruṁ riṁ Adgan tampyal· I viraṅan· Uva
hi[112] I tṅanan· tutuḥ tuṇḍunya blaḥ kapālanya sbittakan· vtaṁnya rantan· Ususnya[113] vtuAkaṇ ḍalmanya ḍuḍuk· hatinya
Inum rāḥnya[114] təhər· pəpəddakan·[115] vkasakan· prānantika, yan para ya riṅ alas paṅanan deniṁ[116] moṁ patu
kan· deniṅ ulā turuṅā,[117] puliraknaniṁ devamanyuḥ yan· para ya ri tgal· sambərniṁ glap tan pahudan·[118] sampallan deniṁ rakṣa
sa paṅananniṁ vuṅgal si pamuṅvan·[119] ta molaḥ ya ri sthananya sarbvaroga rumañcha ya Araḥ[120] ta kita hyaṁ kusika ga_rga
metrī kuruṣya pātāñjala suvuk· lor suvuk kidul kulvan· vetan· bvaṅākan· riṅ ākāśā salambitta
kan· ri hyaṁ kabaiḥ[121] tibākan· riṁ mahāsāmudra klammakan· riṁ ḍavuhan· Alapan· saṁ hyaṁ jalamm er·
duduttann iṁ tuviran· saṁhapniṁ vuhaya, ṅkānaṁṅ mātya Ikanaṁṅ uvvaṁ Anyāya yan· lbuna Ikiṁ[122] vanuA sīma[123] I li
ṅgasuntan· Upadrava riṁ devatā bhraṣṭa liputniṁ phīra muliha riṁkanaṁraka[124] tibākan· riṁ mahārorava
klān· de saṁ yamabala palun de saṁ kiṅkara piṁpitva[125] Ata yan· bimbān· pāpā Ataya saṁsārā sajivakāla salu
Īr·niṁ duḥkha paṅguhanya sarŭpaniṁ lara hidappanya sakelikniṁ janma dadyanannya mavuka tan tammuAṁ sāma vkasa
kan· havu kerir· maṅkana tmahana rikanaṁṅ uvvaṁ lburna Ikiṁ vanuA sīma I liṅgasuntan· Proper right

pva Umuliḥ riy umaḥnira //

app.note: The element read as m by B D N is really just a natural irregularity in the surface of the stone. We do not find mpu before Sindok in any original issues of this king’s reign, only pu.

app.lem: mabasana masayaṁ, makacapuri maṅuñjal· makapas· vuṅkuḍu

app.note: It seems that the engraver initially wrote ṇḍā instead of hā but then made some efforts to efface the strokes differentiating ṇḍā from the required hā.

app.lem: halaṁ pahuṁ halaran· saṁ lbur· poḥ

app.rdg: I bavaṁ saṁ jalaṁ I satyaka ra
app.note: Similar sequences are observed in Gulung-Gulung B11–12 I sbaṁ saṁ vimala, I srāṅan· saṁ satyaka, I madaṇḍər saṁ cakra, ryy āṅgəhan· saṁ vidya; Jeru–Jeru B2 I sbaṁ saṁ bimala, I srāṅan· saṁ satyaka I maḍaṇḍər saṁ cakra, Iy aṅgəhan· saṁ vidya and Sangguran B5–6 I sbaṁ saṁ vimala‚ I bavaṁ saṁ jalaṁ, I maḍaṇḍər· saṁ cakra, ryy āṅgəhan· saṁ tuhan·. The parallels make us expect either I bavaṁ saṁ jalaṁ, I sraṅan saṁ satyaka, or I bavaṁ saṁ jalaṁ, or I sraṅan saṁ satyaka, but what is engraved seems to satisfy none of those expectations. We are unable to confirm the segment saṁ jalaṁ from N’s reading although it is not unexpected in the light of the Sangguran paralle.
Maybe the same name as the citralekha of Wulig.

app.lem: vura_ _kutan· si baṇḍak·, I himad· si sambur·
app.rdg: varakutan· si paṇḍak·, I timad· si samvur·

app.note: T proposes to read this part as Anuṁ sinusuk· Inarpanākan· with reference to A.

app.lem: sīma tasmāt· kabvataknanya patyanantā ta ya kamuṁ hyaṁ
tat· tanoliha I vuntat· tat· tiṅhala I likuran· taruṁ riṁ Adgan ta_ _ _mpyal· I viraṅan· Uvahi
duduttann iṁ tuviran· saṁhapniṁ vuhaya, ṅkānaṁṅ mātya Ikanaṁṅ uvvaṁ Anyāya yan· lbuna Ikiṁ

app.note: N stops reading at this point.
A similar reading but with only one with misplaced anusvāra is observed in Sangguran B37 riṁkanaraka. Corr. rikaṁ naraka.
Cf. Sangguran B41, Gulung-Gulung d8, Jeru-Jeru d7, Paradah I 2b2.

div.p: We used Trigangga’s edition as base text, and compared it to the editions by Nakada which only covers faces A & B and Brandes only for face A up to line 26, as well as the reading furnished by Damais (D, 1955: 56) only for the first 5 lines. (Note that Trigangga’s 2003 edition for the present charter is republished, apparently without modifications, in Hasan Djafar & Trigangga 2019). Our edition was then prepared through direct inspection of the stone at MNI by Eko Bastiawan in March 2023, benefiting from remote supervision and assistance by Arlo Griffiths.
